data.title: Where to find Art Laboe’s call-in radio shows
data.meta_description: Two shows on 93.5 KDAY and other challenges as well as an upcoming live oldies show carry on the legacy of the famous DJ.
data.text:
Even though famous radio DJ Art Laboe died at 97 two years ago, his call-in show lives on.

“The Art Laboe Love Zone” is on the air 9 p.m.-midnight Monday through Thursday, and “The Art Laboe Sunday Special” is on 6 p.m.-midnight on Sunday.

Old School Becky Lu reads current dedications and replays some of Laboe’s memorable moments from his last years on the air, according to Joanna Morones, executive producer for the Art Laboe Connection.

Laboe’s broadcasting career began in the 1940s, and he kept it up until his death on Oct. 7, 2022.

To phone in dedications, call 800-681-2121.

ALSO SEE: El Monte Legion Stadium was a mecca for rock ‘n’ roll in the ’50s for SoCal teens

Laboe’s shows are on KDAY/93.5 in Southern California; Hot 94.1 KISV in Bakersfield; Old School 93.5 KQAV, Lancaster and the Antelope Valley; and Jammin’ 99.5 KMRJ in Palm Springs and the Coachella Valley.

Morones said she is working to keep Laboe’s oldies concerts going as well. The next one will be “80s Soul Jam,” on Nov. 16 at Spotlight 29 Casino in Coachella. Artists will include the SOS Band, Midnight Star and Evelyn “Champagne” King. Tickets start at $35.

Information: 935kday.com/art-laboe, spotlight29.com
